We will work with Cincinnati Bell to ensure that you get the service you need AT NO COST to you!

There was some degree of anticipation leading up to the Governor’s press conference due to the fact that K-12 schools and athletics were anticipated topics of the discussion. Good news for today! None of the information shared impacts our 2020-2021 Learning Plan or our ability to look forward to sports and other extracurricular activities.

Next hurdle to clear: elimination of the need to COVID test all participants in extracurricular activities within 72 hours of a contest. If this is not resolved, there will not be a school in the state able to adhere ... we will keep you posted. #PantherPride #OnTheRise

In the coming weeks, many Americans will be affected either directly or indirectly by COVID-19 and Charter is focused on serving and supporting our 29 million customers. To ease the strain in this challenging time, beginning Monday, March 16, Charter commits to the following for 60 days:

Charter will offer free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription at any service level up to 100 Mbps. To enroll call 1-844-488-8395. Installation fees will be waived for new student households.

For eligible low-income households without school-aged children, Charter continues to offer Spectrum Internet Assist, a low-cost broadband program delivering speeds of 30 Mbps.

Charter will open its Wi-Fi hotspots across our footprint for public use.

I am proud to inform you that our Athletic Trainer, Kim Barber Foss, has been selected to receive the 2020 NATA Secondary School Athletic Trainer of the Year for NATA District 4!

We are so proud of Kim and she is extremely deserving of this recognition!

Kim will be recognized at the 71st NATA Clinical Symposia & AT Expo in June of 2020 in Atlanta, Georgia.
